definition: blinded by greed (idiom)
surname Li
sharp/favorable/advantage/benefit/profit/interest/to do good to/to benefit
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
desire/appetite/passion/lust/greed
to smoke/to fumigate/to assail the nostrils/to perfume
variant of 熏[xun1]
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Those embezzlers and grafters who are reckless with greed must be dealt with seriously in accordance with the policy.
sentences.chinese: 利欲熏心的贪污盗窃分子，一定要按照政策严肃处理。

sentences.english: The careerism and money seemed only to embolden their blindness.
sentences.chinese: 利欲熏心与金钱看上去仅仅加重了他们的盲目愚昧。

sentences.english: Driven by their greed for money, some officials often put their political careers on the line.
sentences.chinese: 由于利欲熏心，有些官员常常拿自己的政治生涯冒险。

definition: to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking
to lose one's head through material greed (idiom)
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
variant of 唯利是圖|唯利是图[wei2 li4 shi4 tu2]
mad about money (idiom)
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
(of greed, lust etc) to dominate one's thoughts
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
to swindle/to cheat
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
personal gain/(one's own) selfish interest
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to be greedy in getting money
by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
